master.label: Master key: types of tree found in gardens and urban areas

a.label: Leaves needle-like or scale-like and often overlapping
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaves not needle-like, scale-like or overlapping

more.label: Tips on identifying leaves and needles

a.label: Leaves in pairs, opposite each other on shoots
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaves alternate on shoots
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

more.label: Tips on identifying leaves and needles

a.label: Leaves divided into separate leaflets
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaves with one blade, possibly indented into lobes, but not divided into leaflets
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

more.label: Tips on identifying leaves and needles

a.label: Leaves evergreen

b.label: Leaves deciduous
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

more.label: Tips on identifying leaves and needles

a.label: Fruits fleshy or juicy

b.label: Fruits dry
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

more.label: Tips on identifying fruits and seeds

key1.label: Key 1: trees with leaves that are needle-like or scale-like

a.label: All leaves scale-like, usually pressed against the twig
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: All leaves needle-like, usually spread widely apart
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

c.label: Some leaves scale-like, others needle-like
c.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Scale-leaves at least 30mm long, rigid and sharp-edged
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Scale-leaves less than 30mm long, not rigid or sharp
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Deciduous tree; foliage is wispy; pink or white flowers

b.label: Evergreen tree with cones; foliage is dense
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Cone is egg-shaped with overlapping scales, eventually wide-spreading like petals of a flower; crushed foliage smells of pineapple

b.label: Cone is egg- or ball-shaped, scales meet at edges and don’t overlap, scales don’t become wide-spreading; crushed foliage doesn’t smell of pineapple
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Cone is egg-shaped with more than 15 scales; bark is very thick, with visible fibres, and is rather soft or spongy

b.label: Cone is ball-shaped, with fewer than 10 scales; bark is hard
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Needles are in two flat, parallel rows, at least on the short shoots growing off longer ones; fruit is scarlet and berry-like

b.label: All the needles are in clusters or are parted on either side of shoot, but not in flat rows; fruit is a woody cone

a.label: Needles are all on their own at their position on the shoot
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Most needles grouped around the shoot, in pairs or bundles of 2 or more
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Cones stand upright on branches; needles are attached by a sucker-like base

b.label: Cones hang downwards from branches; the base of the needles are not sucker-like
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Needles leave behind their peg-like bases after falling
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Needles leave behind their cushion-like bases after falling
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Most needles are in bundles of 2–5

b.label: Most needles are arranged around the shoot in clusters of 3, 10 or more, rarely in pairs
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Needles in bundles of 2
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Needles in bundles of 3

c.label: Needles in bundles of 5
c.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Needles on all shoots are arranged in rings of 3 going around the shoot, or occasionally in pairs
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Needles on short shoots, in clusters of 10 or more
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: A deciduous tree; the cones are egg-shaped

b.label: An evergreen tree; the cones are barrel-shaped
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Leaves of main shoots are scale-like, leaves of short shoots are needle-like, up to 20mm long, arranged in 2 rows; foliage doesn’t smell unpleasant
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaves mostly scale-like; those towards the tips of shoots are needle-like, in opposite pairs, 5–6mm long; crushed foliage smells unpleasant

key2.label: Key 2: trees with broad leaves, arranged opposite each other in pairs

a.label: Leaves palmately divided into separate leaflets, the leaflets extending from the leaf stalk
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaves pinnately divided into separate leaflets, the leaflets in two rows on the stalk

c.label: Leaves are sometimes lobed, but are not divided into leaflets
c.credit: ©  The Dow Gardens Archive, Dow Gardens, United States

a.label: Small trees with ridged, corky bark; the fruit is a berry
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Tall trees with smooth or slightly wrinkled bark; fruits are dry and wing-shaped

a.label: Twigs are clearly flattened where the buds or leaves are attached; leaves are hairy on the underside; 1 fruit per stalk
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Twigs are not flattened where the buds or leaves are attached; leaves are hairless on the underside; fruits in pairs on the stalks
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Flowers have no petals; winter buds are black

b.label: Flowers have narrow white petals; winter buds are grey or brown

a.label: Leaves are deeply palmately lobed; fruits are wing-shaped and in pairs
a.credit: ©  The Dow Gardens Archive, Dow Gardens, United States

b.label: Leaves are not lobed or are only very shallowly lobed; fruit is either a woody capsule, a berry or a long, narrow pod
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Leaf edges are toothed

b.label: Leaf edges are not toothed

a.label: An evergreen tree, leaves are usually bluish-green and smell of eucalyptus when crushed; bark is usually shredding or flaking

b.label: A deciduous tree, leaves are pale or bright green and don’t smell when crushed; bark is not shredding
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: A tall tree up to 20m; leaves are 10–25cm long; flowers are 5cm or more across; fruit is a long, narrow pod that remains after the leaves fall

b.label: A small tree to 8m; leaves are 4–10cm long; flowers are 4mm across; fruit is a red berry

a.label: Leaves with 3-13 lobes. If 5-lobed, then any teeth present aren’t small, coarse, round-tipped and numerous, or flowers/fruits don’t hang in tails
a.credit: ©  The Dow Gardens Archive, Dow Gardens, United States

b.label: Leaves 5-lobed with many small, coarse, round-tipped teeth; flowers/fruits in hanging tails

key3.label: Key 3: trees with leaves arranged alternately, divided into separate leaflets

a.label: Leaves divided into 3 leaflets
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaves divided into more than 3 leaflets
b.credit: © Karan A. Rawlins, University of Georgia, United States

a.label: Twigs are thick and densely covered with velvety hairs; flower heads (and later the seed heads) are dense, cone-shaped and hairy

b.label: Twigs not velvety; flowers and fruits are not in hairy, cone-shaped heads

a.label: Twigs have a pair of thorns at the base of each leaf
a.credit: © John Cardina, The Ohio State University, United States

b.label: Twigs have no spines or thorns

a.label: Twigs have distinctive Y-shaped scars where leaves have fallen; cut twigs leak latex; flowers are in catkins or clusters of 1–5

b.label: Leaf scars are not Y-shaped; cut twigs don’t leak latex; flowers are numerous and in clusters

a.label: Leaflets are not lobed, they are not foul-smelling; the fruit is a pod

b.label: Leaflets have a few teeth or lobes in the lower half only and they are foul-smelling when crushed; the fruit is a papery, winged seed
b.credit: © Karan A. Rawlins, University of Georgia, United States

c.label: Leaflets are toothed or lobed, not foul-smelling; the fruit is a papery capsule

d.label: Leaflets are toothed or lobed, not foul-smelling; the fruit is a papery capsule

a.label: Lower part of the leaf is divided into 1–4 pairs of leaflets, the upper part is lobed in places but not completely divided
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaves are completely divided into 6 or more pairs of leaflets
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Ripe fruits are orange-red to vermillion-red or occasionally yellow, with yellow pulp
a.credit: © Boris Hrasovec, Faculty of Forestry, Croatia
a.result: Rowans with orange or vermillion fruit

b.label: Ripe fruits are white to pink or crimson, with white pulp
b.result: Rowan with white, pink or crimson fruit

key4.label: Key 4: evergreen trees with leaves arranged alternately, not divided into leaflets

a.label: Leaves have spiny edges

b.label: Leaves sometimes have toothed edges but are not spiny
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Leaves are white- or green-felted on the underside; fruit is an acorn; flowers are green, the male flowers are in slender catkins

b.label: Leaves are paler but hairless on the underside; fruit is a berry; flowers are white and in small clusters

a.label: Leaves are aromatic when crushed
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaves are not aromatic when crushed

a.label: Leaves smell of eucalyptus when crushed, or rarely of lemon, the edges are flat

b.label: Leaves smell of almonds when crushed; the edges are rolled under
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

c.label: Leaves smell of bay when crushed, the edges are wavy
c.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Leaves are densely covered with rusty brown or grey hairs on the underside
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaves are hairless or have white hairs on the underside
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Flowers are on their own
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Flowers are in clusters

a.label: Flowers are roughly 1cm long, urn-shaped and in small drooping clusters; the fruit is a warty, matt-red berry
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Flowers are 3–5.5cm long, bell-shaped and in large rounded clusters; the fruit is a capsule

c.label: Flowers are 1–1.5cm across and flat, with up to 100 in erect spikes; the fruit is a smooth, shiny black berry
c.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

d.label: Flowers are less than 1cm across, flat and in clusters; the fruit is a red, orange or blue-black berry

key5.label: Key 5: deciduous trees with leaves arranged alternately, not divided into leaflets; fruits fleshy or juicy

a.label: Leaves are fan-shaped with a central notch

b.label: Leaves are not fan-shaped
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: At least some leaves are lobed

b.label: Leaves are undivided, the edges may be toothed but not lobed

a.label: Leaves are palmately lobed, distinctly bristly to the touch on the upper side

b.label: Leaves are pinnately lobed, smooth or softly hairy on the upper side

a.label: Some leaves are lobed and all are toothed; the fruit resembles a raspberry, red or purple when ripe

b.label: All leaves are lobed; the fruit is pear-shaped and brownish purple when ripe
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Twigs are thorny

b.label: Twigs are not thorny

a.label: Leaves are not toothed

b.label: Leaves are toothed

a.label: Flowers and fruits are in cylinder- or cone-shaped spikes

b.label: Flowers and fruits are on their own, in pairs or in clusters

a.label: Flowers are less than 10mm in diameter, the petals are broadly oval; the fruit is smooth at the apex

b.label: Flowers are more than 10mm in diameter, the petals are narrow and strap-shaped; the fruit is crowned with the withered sepals

a.label: Flowers have 1 style; sepals are absent on the ripe fruit; 1 seed

b.label: Flowers have 2 or more styles; sepals are usually present on the ripe fruit; 2 or more seeds

a.label: Twigs are very thorny

b.label: Twigs are not thorny or have only occasional thorns

a.label: Fruit is less than 2cm long; the bark often has distinctive horizontal bands of pores
a.credit: © Terry Spivey, USDA Forest Service, Bugwood.org

b.label: Fruit is more than 2cm long; the bark doesn’t have horizontal bands of pores

a.label: Fruit has a velvety skin, even when fully ripe

b.label: Fruit has a smooth skin, often with a greyish waxy bloom on the skin

a.label: Young twigs are green, smooth and glossy

b.label: Young twigs are brown or grey, dull and often hairy
b.credit: © University of Arkansas Division of Agriculture

a.label: Flowers and fruits in clusters of 11 or more, with their stalks not arising from a central point
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Flowers and fruits in clusters of 10 or fewer, with their stalks all arising from a central point

a.label: Twigs are thorny or spiny, sometimes with very few spines

b.label: Twigs are not thorny

a.label: Fruit is usually pear-shaped, with gritty flesh; styles are not joined together at the base
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Fruit is usually apple-shaped, the flesh is not gritty; styles are joined together at the base
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Fruits less than 4cm long
a.credit: ©  The Dow Gardens Archive, Dow Gardens, United States

b.label: Fruits more than 4cm long
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

key6.label: Key 6: deciduous trees with leaves arranged alternately, not divided into leaflets; fruits dry

a.label: Leaves are lobed
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaves are not lobed

a.label: Leaves are square or notched at the tip; the flowers are up to 5cm long and are on their own
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaves are rounded or pointed at the tip; the flowers are much smaller, in clusters or catkins

a.label: Leaves are pinnately lobed; the fruit is an acorn

b.label: Leaves are palmately or irregularly lobed; the fruits form a catkin or globe-shaped head
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Leaves are felted with white or grey hairs on the underside
a.credit: © Richard Old, XID Services, Inc., United States

b.label: Leaves are smooth or sparsely hairy on the underside

a.label: Bark is flaking in large patches; the fruits form a soft, hairy ball like a pom-pom

b.label: Bark is fissured, not flaking; the fruits form a stiff, spiky ball like the head of a mace

a.label: Bark is silver or white

b.label: Bark is greyish or brown

a.label: Tree is weeping, the twigs and smaller branches hang loosely; the bark has black, diamond-shaped splits
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Tree is not weeping; the bark is often peeling but doesn’t have black diamond-shaped splits

a.label: Leaves are more than 3 times as long as they are wide

b.label: Leaves are less than 3 times as long as they are wide

a.label: Leaf edges are coarsely toothed, the teeth end in a softly spiny tip; the seeds are enclosed in a softly spiny husk
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaf edges are not indented but may have small, fine teeth; the seeds have a plume of silky hairs at one end
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Tree is weeping, the smaller branches hang downwards, often almost to the ground

b.label: Tree is not weeping

a.label: Fruit is a small, woody cone, they are numerous and stay on the tree until spring

b.label: Fruit is not a woody cone

a.label: Leaf edges aren’t indented
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaf edges are toothed, the teeth may be very small
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Leaves are almost circular; flowers are pea-like and found on the trunk and main branches as well as the twigs
a.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

b.label: Leaves are oval or egg-shaped; flowers aren't pea-like

a.label: Leaves are flat and 15cm or more in length; the flowers have 5 or more large petals that are white or pink; the fruit is cone-like but not woody

b.label: Leaves are up to 9cm long with wavy edges; the flowers are greenish and don’t have petals; the fruit has a spiny husk

a.label: Flowers and fruits are in clusters suspended beneath an oblong, wing-shaped bract; the leaves are roughly heart-shaped

b.label: Flowers and fruits are in cylindrical catkins; the leaves are oval to oblong

a.label: Flowers are in small clusters; the fruit is a seed surrounded by a papery wing

b.label: Flowers are in slender, hanging catkins; the fruit is a nut
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Leaves hairy on both surfaces; fruits are solitary or in clusters of a few; each nut is wrapped in a leafy sheath

b.label: Leaves hairy only on veins on the underside; fruits are in a hanging catkin, paired nuts are attached to a large, 3-lobed, bract
b.credit: © Università di Trieste, Dipartimento di Biologia. Photo: Andrea Moro

a.label: Flowers or fruits arranged in roughly cylinder-shaped spikes, 11 or more per spike

b.label: Flowers or fruits on their own or in clusters of 10 or fewer

a.label: Leaves hairless or with white hairs along midrib, sometimes only where veins join; flowers 10-15mm across
a.credit: © USDA Forest Service – Ogden Archive, USDA Forest Service, Bugwood.org

b.label: Leaves have rusty or orange hairs underneath, each side of the midrib; flowers 8mm across
b.credit: © Bill Cook, Michigan State University, Bugwood.org

a.label: Flower and leaf stalks densely hairy; leaf edges have pointed teeth

b.label: Flower and leaf stalks hairless or almost hairless; leaf edges have pointed teeth, often with thin, bristle-like tips

c.label: Flower and leaf stalks hairless; leaf edges have blunt or round teeth, often with a claw-shaped gland at the tip

a.label: Sepal edges are toothed; leaves hairless on the upper side with hairy veins on the underside

b.label: Sepal edges not toothed; leaves hairy on both surfaces

a.label: Bark on trunk and branches very glossy, purplish-brown and peeling in thin, copper-brown strips

b.label: Bark mostly dull grey or brown, sometimes peeling to reveal shiny red-brown on the trunk

a.label: Flowers less than 20mm across, on stalks up to 15mm long, not arising from a central point; fruit less than 10mm long

b.label: Flowers more than 20mm across, on stalks more than 15mm long, arising from a central point; fruit more than 10mm long

a.label: Flowers cup-shaped; leaves dull on the upper side, sparsely hairy on the underside

b.label: Flowers saucer-shaped; leaves glossy on the upper side, hairless on the underside
